decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the Cephalid Breakfast combo by using Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor to mill the library, then Dread Return a creature like Thassa's Oracle to win the game. The deck features a mix of card draw, counter spells, and removal to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The land base is optimized for color fixing and includes utility lands like Urza's Saga. Overall, the deck aims to win the game in a fast and efficient manner through its powerful combo interactions.

The deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, and then bringing them back into play using spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. It also includes disruptive cards like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo, as well as utility cards like Brainstorm and Ponder for card selection. The goal is to cheat out powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier early in the game and overwhelm the opponent with their powerful abilities.

The deck focuses on utilizing Nadu, Winged Wisdom to create a powerful combo with Nomads en-Kor and Delighted Halfling to draw through the deck quickly and generate massive amounts of mana. Teferi, Time Raveler helps to protect the combo, while cards like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares provide disruption and removal. The deck also includes Green Sun's Zenith to tutor for key pieces and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath for card advantage. The mana base includes a variety of dual lands and fetch lands to ensure consistency in casting spells.

This deck focuses on quickly playing strong Eldrazi creatures and controlling the opponent's resources with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer. It also utilizes mana acceleration with cards like Lotus Petal and Grim Monolith to play big threats ahead of schedule. The inclusion of Wasteland and Blast Zone provide additional disruption to prevent the opponent from stabilizing. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and disruption, quickly closing out games before the opponent can establish their strategy.

The main strategy of this deck is to use lands as control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up a win condition with cards like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage. The deck utilizes cards like Mox Diamond, Exploration, and Life from the Loam to ramp up quickly and generate value from lands. Crop Rotation and Once Upon a Time help tutor for key lands, while cards like Wasteland and The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale disrupt the opponent's mana base and creatures. Overall, the deck aims to control the game through land interactions and eventually win through a powerful land combo.

The main focus of this Combo - Show and Tell deck is to quickly and efficiently cheat powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Atraxa, Grand Unifier into play using cards like Show and Tell and Omniscience. By utilizing cards such as Brainstorm, Force of Will, and Cunning Wish, the deck aims to protect its combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Stock Up and Lotus Petal helps to accelerate the deck's game plan and ensure a swift victory.

The main focus of the deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, then bring them back onto the battlefield to overwhelm the opponent. This combo strategy is supported by disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the reanimation process. The deck also includes control elements such as Brazen Borrower and Wasteland to control the board and prevent the opponent from executing their own game plan. The key concept is to assemble the combo pieces efficiently and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure victory.

This deck aims to maintain control of the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy while deploying evasive threats and efficient removal spells. The key strategy is to quickly get ahead on board with cards like Brazen Borrower and Murktide Regent, while using disruption like Thoughtseize and Daze to slow down the opponent's game plan. The deck also leverages powerful card draw options like Brainstorm and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to stay ahead and maintain the tempo advantage. By combining aggression with disruption, this deck aims to win the game before the opponent can recover.

The main concept of this Aggro - Death & Taxes Legacy deck is to use disruptive creatures and removal spells to control the opponent's board while putting pressure on them with efficient creatures and equipment. The deck utilizes cards like Swords to Plowshares, Thoughtseize, and Skyclave Apparition for removal, while Stoneforge Mystic and Aether Vial help tutor for equipment and creatures quickly. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion adds an extra layer of synergy and value to the deck, allowing for additional card advantage and flexibility in longer games.

This Dragon Stompy deck focuses on disrupting opponents by using aggressive creatures like Pyrogoyf and Broadside Bombardiers, along with powerful spells like Sundering Eruption. The key strategy is to lock opponents out of playing their spells with cards like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Chalice of the Void, while also ramping up mana quickly with cards like Chrome Mox and City of Traitors. The overall goal is to overwhelm opponents with fast, disruptive plays and powerful threats to secure a victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler, backed up by efficient removal spells such as Lightning Bolt and Force of Will. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Daze and Force of Negation, while also generating card advantage with cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder. The deck also utilizes value cards like Mishra's Bauble and Questing Druid to maintain tempo and outpace the opponent in the Legacy format.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of countermagic, removal, and powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Time Raveler. Stoneforge Mystic is used to search for key equipment like Batterskull and Kaldra Compleat, providing additional threats and value. The deck also includes versatile cards like Prismatic Ending and Snapcaster Mage for flexibility. The mana base is tuned to support the deck's color requirements, with a mix of fetch lands and basic lands to ensure stability. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents with a mix of disruption and threats.
